com.simsilica.ethereal.zone

Class StateCollector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.simsilica.ethereal.zone.StateCollector

  • public class StateCollector
extends java.lang.Object
    Uses a background thread to periodically collect the accumulated state for the zones and send the blocks of state to zone state listeners.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()

      • addListener

        public void addListener(StateListener l)
        Adds a listener that self-indicates which specific zones it is interested in from one frame to the next. This is necessary so that it syncs with the background state collection in a way that does not cause partial state, etc... it's also nicer to to the background threads and synchronization if zone interest is synched with updates.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(StateListener l)

      • setIdleSleepTime

        public void setIdleSleepTime(long millis)
        Sets the sleep() time for the state collector's idle periods. This defaults to 1 which keeps the CPU happier while also providing timely checks against the interval time. However, for higher rates of state collection (lower collectionPeriods such as 16 ms or 60 FPS) on windows, sleep(1) may take longer than 1/60th of a second or close enough to still cause collection frame drops. In that case, it can be configured to 0 which should provide timelier updates. Set to -1 to avoid sleeping at all in which case the thread will consume 100% of a single core in order to busy wait between collection intervals.

      • getIdleSleepTime

        public long getIdleSleepTime()

        protected void initialize()
        Called from the background thread when it first starts up.

      • publish

        protected void publish(StateBlock b)

      • publishFrame

        protected void publishFrame(StateFrame frame)
        Adjusts the per-listener zone interest based on latest listener state, then publishes the state frame to all interested listeners.

      • collect

        protected void collect()
        Called by the background thread to collect all of the accumulated state since the last collection and distribute it to the state listeners. This is called once per "collectionPeriod".

      • terminate

        protected void terminate()
        Called by the background thread when it is shutting down. Currently does nothing.

      • collectionError

        protected void collectionError(java.lang.Exception e)
